[[File:Newark-prudential-terrorist-threat-media-2004.jpg|thumb|News media satellite up-link trucks and photojournalists gathered outside the [[Prudential Headquarters|Prudential Financial headquarters]] in [[Newark, New Jersey]], in August 2004 following the announcement of evidence of a terrorist threat to it and to buildings in [[New York City]].]]
'''Media circus''' is a [[colloquial]] [[metaphor]], or [[idiom]], describing a [[news]] event for which the level of media coverage — measured by such factors as the number of [[reporter]]s at the scene and the amount of material broadcast or published — is perceived to be excessive or out of proportion to the event being covered. Coverage that is [[Sensationalism|sensationalistic]] can add to the perception the event is the subject of a media circus. The term is meant to critique the coverage of the event by comparing it to the [[spectacle]] and pageantry of a [[circus]]. Usage of the term in this sense became common in the 1970s.<ref name="mj1">{{cite news | title=Gilmore case turning into a circus for media | work=Milwaukee Journal | quote=The worldwide attention that condemned killer Gary Gilmore is receiving has turned his case into a media circus Utah residents are saying | date=1976-12-03 }}</ref><ref name="ei1">{{cite news | title=Only in America - the Gary Gilmore Circus has everything but dancing bears | work=The Evening Independent | date=1976-12-08 | quote=There is most appallingly, an only-in-America spectacle wherein a quest for justice becomes an extravaganza for the fast buck. Come, come, come to the circus.| first=Gene | last=Miller}}</ref> It can also be called a [[media feeding frenzy]] or just media frenzy, especially when they cover the media coverage.
==History== [[File:Tonya harding returning from norway 1994.jpg|thumb|right|[[Tonya Harding]] arriving at [[Portland International Airport]] after the [[1994 Winter Olympics]].]]
Although the idea is older, the term ''media circus'' began to appear around the mid-1970s. An early example is from the 1976 book by author Lynn Haney, in which she writes about a romance in which the athlete [[Chris Evert]] was involved: "Their courtship, after all, had been a '''media circus.'"''<ref>Lynn Haney (1976). [https://books.google.com/books?vid=ISBN0399610375&id=ffEIhrn5HPgC&q=%22media+circus%22+date:1970-1977&dq=%22media+circus%22+date:1970-1977&pgis=1 ''Chris Evert, the Young Champion''].</ref> A few years later ''[[The Washington Post]]'' had a similar courtship example in which it reported, "[[Princess Grace]] herself is still traumatized by the memory of her own ''media-circus'' wedding to [[Prince Rainier]] in 1956."<ref>''[[Washington Post]]'' B1, June 29, 1978. This is the oldest quote the ''[[Oxford English Dictionary]]'' has listed, although obviously there are older occurrences.</ref> The term has become increasingly popular with time since the 1970s. Reasons for being critical of the media are varied; at the core of most criticism is that there may be a significant [[opportunity cost]] when other more important news issues get less public attention as a result of coverage of the hyped issue.
Media circuses make up the central plot device in the 1951 movie ''[[Ace in the Hole (1951 film)|Ace in the Hole]]'' about a self-interested reporter who, covering a mine disaster, allows a man to die trapped underground. It cynically examines the relationship between the media and the news they report. The movie was subsequently re-issued as ''The Big Carnival'', with "carnival" referring to what we now call a "circus". The movie was based on real-life [[Floyd Collins]] who in 1925 was trapped in a Kentucky cave drawing so much media attention that it became the third largest media event between the two World Wars (the other two being [[Charles Lindbergh#Fame|Lindbergh's solo flight]] and the [[Lindbergh kidnapping]]).<ref>Brucker, R. and Murray, R. ''Trapped! the Story of Floyd Collins'', University Press of Kentucky, 1983.</ref>
==Examples== Events described as a media circus include:
===Aruba=== * The disappearance, and assumed death, of [[Natalee Holloway]] (2005–).<ref name=CNN-20050823-Holloway>{{cite news|publisher=Caribbean Net News |url=http://www.caribbeannetnews.com/2005/08/23/enough.shtml |title=When is enough Natalee Holloway madness enough? |date=2005-08-23 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080622044858/http://www.caribbeannetnews.com/2005/08/23/enough.shtml |archivedate=2008-06-22 |df= }}</ref> <!--NOTE: UN-SOURCED? WILL BE DELETED.-->
===Australia=== *The [[Azaria Chamberlain disappearance]] of 2-month-old baby in [[outback]] Australia (1980).<ref>{{cite news|title=Vindication at Last for a Woman Scorned by Australia’s News Outlets |work=[[The New York Times]]|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/11/17/us/vindication-at-last-for-a-woman-scorned-by-australias-news-media.html|date=Nov 16, 2014}}</ref> *The [[Beaconsfield Mine collapse]] (2006).<ref>{{cite news|title=Media circus comes digging for gold |work=[[Sydney Morning Herald]]|url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/national/media-circus-comes-digging-for-gold/2006/05/03/1146335804552.html&cid=0|date=May 4, 2006}}</ref> *2009 [[Violence against Indians in Australia controversy]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.radioaustralia.net.au/international/radio/today/an-indian-boy-and-a-media-circus|archiveurl=https://archive.today/20120708090740/http://www.radioaustralia.net.au/international/radio/today/an-indian-boy-and-a-media-circus|deadurl=yes|title=Radio - ABC Radio Australia|date=8 July 2012|archivedate=8 July 2012|publisher=}}</ref> *[[Schapelle Corby]] Drug smuggler (2014).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2014-02-07/schapelle-corby-backgrounder/5218074|title=Schapelle Corby: Drug claims, media circus and the family saga that gripped a nation|work=ABC News|accessdate=10 December 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/features/2014/02/australia-schapelle-corby-phenomenon-20142131312291167.html|title=Australia's Schapelle Corby phenomenon|author=Geraldine Nordfeldt|publisher=|accessdate=10 December 2015}}</ref>
===Brazil=== *The [[Isabella Nardoni case|murder of Isabella Nardoni]] (2008).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.globalvoicesonline.org/2008/04/24/brasil-making-a-child-murder-into-a-media-show/|title=Brazil: Making a child murder into a media show · Global Voices|work=Global Voices|accessdate=10 December 2015}}</ref> <!--NOTE: UN-SOURCED? WILL BE DELETED.-->
===Canada=== *[[Conrad Black]], business magnate of newspapers, convicted of fraud, embezzlement and corporate destruction, imprisoned in Florida. *Toronto mayor [[Rob Ford]]'s life, including his usage of drugs, alcohol and involvement with organized crime (2013).<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news2/interactives/ford-admission-headlines/|title=Rob Ford's crack admission creates media frenzy|publisher=CBC|date=November 5, 2013|accessdate=November 14, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/constant-circus-around-rob-ford-a-distraction-councillors-say-1.1302275|title='Constant circus' around Rob Ford a distraction, councillors say|publisher=CBC|date=May 31, 2013|accessdate=November 14, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cp24.com/news/ford/ford-under-fire-all-stories/city-hall-tours-relocated-amid-ford-media-circus-1.1544101|title=City hall tours relocated amid Ford media circus|publisher=CP24|date=November 14, 2013|accessdate=November 14, 2013}}</ref> *[[Paul Bernardo]] and [[Karla Homolka]] (serial killers). *[[Omar Khadr]] (detained as a minor at Guantanamo Bay in 2001, transferred to Canada in 2012, released in May 2015). *[[Murder of Victoria Stafford]] (8-year-old girl murdered for unclear reasons by a couple who have unclear relations to each other and the victim). *[[Jian Ghomeshi]] ([[Canadian Broadcasting Corporation|CBC]] employee alleged to have committed more than a dozen sex assaults over more than a decade). *[[Luka Rocco Magnotta]], gay porn actor convicted of killing Chinese roommate and mailing remains to the Prime Minister and an elementary school in British Columbia. *Elijah Marsh, a 3-year-old Toronto boy of black descent who wandered outside in February 2015 in just a diaper, shirt and boots and froze to death.
===Chile=== * [[2010 Copiapó mining accident]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Americas/2010/1015/As-media-circus-wanes-Chile-miners-families-turn-spotlight-on-reporters-antics|title=As media circus wanes, Chile miners' families turn spotlight on reporters' antics|author=The Christian Science Monitor|date=15 October 2010|work=The Christian Science Monitor|accessdate=10 December 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/programmes/world_news_america/9082400.stm|title=BBC News - World News America - The media circus around Chile's trapped miners|publisher=|accessdate=10 December 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://blogs.forbes.com/laceyrose/2010/10/12/this-is-just-the-beginning-for-the-chilean-miner-media-circus/?boxes=Homepagechannels|title=The 'Get' Game Gets Going at Chile Miner Media Circus|author=Lacey Rose|work=Forbes|accessdate=10 December 2015}}</ref> <!--NOTE: UN-SOURCED? WILL BE DELETED.-->
===Colombia=== *The [[Death of Luis Andres Colmenares]] (2010).<ref>{{cite news|title=El caso Colmenares y la fascinación de los medios y del público. ¿Qué tiene de especial? ¿Por qué el circo a su alrededor?|language=spanish |work=[[Caracol Radio]]|url=http://caracol.com.co/programa/2012/06/06/audios/1339010760_701675.html|date=May 4, 2006}}</ref>
===France=== *The investigation on the [[murder of Grégory Villemin]] (starting in 1984, still ongoing as the case is still unsolved). *The capture of [[Mohamed Merah]] in March 2012. *The funerals of singer [[Johnny Hallyday]] in December 2017.
===Italy=== * [[Amanda Knox]] (convicted of the [[murder of Meredith Kercher]]; her conviction was subsequently overturned).<ref>{{cite news | title=Amanda Knox compared to Goebbels by prosecutors | url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/italy/8784918/Amanda-Knox-compared-to-Nazi-Joseph-Goebbels.html | last=Squires | first=Nick | date=September 23, 2011 | accessdate=2011-09-27 | work=Telegraph (UK) | location=[[Perugia]] | quote="The trial must be held here, in this courtroom. This lobbying, this media and political circus, this heavy interference, forget all of it," the prosecutor said }}</ref>
===Malaysia=== * The missing [[Malaysia Airlines Flight 370]] (2014).<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.straitstimes.com/breaking-news/se-asia/story/missing-mh370-day-6-and-media-circus-malaysia-shows-few-signs-relenting-|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140313230750/http://www.straitstimes.com/breaking-news/se-asia/story/missing-mh370-day-6-and-media-circus-malaysia-shows-few-signs-relenting-|archivedate=2014-03-13 |title=Missing MH370: Day 6 and media circus in Malaysia shows few signs of relenting |work=[[The Straits Times]] |date=March 13, 2014 |first=Joyce |last=Lim |accessdate=April 17, 2014 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.insidetoronto.com/opinion-story/4436839-desi-dialogues-media-s-coverage-of-missing-malaysia-airlines-flight-appalling/ |title=Desi Dialogues: Media's coverage of missing Malaysia Airlines flight appalling |first=Rakshande |last=Italia |date=March 28, 2014 |work=[[Inside Toronto]] |accessdate=April 17, 2014 }}</ref>
===Peru=== * [[Joran van der Sloot]] and the death of Stephany Flores Ramirez (2010).<ref name=RNW-20100609-Peru>{{cite news|publisher=[[Radio Netherlands Worldwide]]|url=http://www.rnw.nl/english/bulletin/peru-police-confirm-van-der-sloots-murder-confession|title=Peru police confirm Van der Sloot's murder confession|date=2010-06-09|access-date=2010-06-10|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100611025832/http://www.rnw.nl/english/bulletin/peru-police-confirm-van-der-sloots-murder-confession|archive-date=2010-06-11|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref> ===Poland=== * The assumed discovery of the [[Nazi gold train]] in [[Wałbrzych]] (''Waldenburg''), 2015
===Romania=== * [[Disappearance and alleged murder of Elodia Ghinescu]], especially on [[OTV (Romanian TV station)|OTV]], which aired a couple hundred episodes on the matter.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://stiri.kappa.ro/actualitate/19-08-2009/fenomenul-elodia-dupa-doi-ani-30420.html|archiveurl=https://archive.today/20131204175000/http://stiri.kappa.ro/actualitate/19-08-2009/fenomenul-elodia-dupa-doi-ani-30420.html|deadurl=yes|title=STIRI - Fenomenul „Elodia“, dupa doi ani|date=4 December 2013|archivedate=4 December 2013|publisher=}}</ref><ref>[http://www.irex.org/system/files/EE_MSI_09_se_Romania.pdf MEDIA SUSTAINABILITY INDEX 2009]{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, p. 89</ref><ref>http://www.cna.ro/IMG/pdf/08.01-09.04.2008.1-DDD_OTV.pdf</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://adevarul.ro/news/eveniment/fenomenul-elodia--doi-ani-1_50aca5637c42d5a663878834/index.html|title=Fenomenul "Elodia", după doi ani|work=adevarul.ro|accessdate=10 December 2015}}</ref>
===South Africa=== * [[Oscar Pistorius]] on [[Trial of Oscar Pistorius|trial]] for death of his girlfriend [[Reeva Steenkamp]] (2013–14).<ref name=pistorius-Mar2014>{{cite news |title=The Oscar Pistorius trial: Africa’s O.J. Simpson? |date=March 1, 2014 |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/worldviews/wp/2014/03/01/the-oscar-pistorius-trial-africas-o-j-simpson/ |work=Washington Post |accessdate=April 18, 2014 |first=Adam |last=Taylor }}</ref><ref name=pistorius-Apr2014>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/oscar-pistorius/10760333/Oscar-Pistorius-and-the-echoes-of-OJ-Simpson.html |title=Oscar Pistorius and the echoes of OJ Simpson |work=The Telegraph |date=12 April 2014 |accessdate=18 April 2014 |location=London |first=John |last=Hiscock}}</ref>
===Thailand=== * [[Tham Luang cave rescue]]<ref>{{cite web|url=https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-thailand-accident-cave-rescuers/throng-of-volunteers-gather-to-rescue-thai-boys-trapped-in-cave-idUKKBN1JW0VI|title=Throng of volunteers gather to rescue Thai boys trapped in cave|first=Panu|last=Wongcha-um|publisher=}}</ref>
===Ukraine=== * [[Mykola Melnychenko]]'s involvement in the [[Cassette Scandal]] (1999–2000).<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/media-circus-follows-melnychenko-to-warsaw-21721.html |title=Media circus follows Melnychenko to Warsaw |date=October 28, 2004 |accessdate=July 21, 2014 |work=Kyiv Post }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |issue=50 |volume=LXXIII |first=Yana |last=Sedova |date=December 11, 2005 |url=http://www.ukrweekly.com/old/archive/2005/500501.shtml |work=Kyiv Press Bureau |accessdate=July 21, 2014 }}</ref>
===United Kingdom=== * The [[Charlie Gard case]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/voices/charlie-gard-court-case-ruling-became-media-circus-a7857841.html|title=Why did Charlie Gard’s court case become a media circus?|publisher=}}</ref> *The life, death and funeral of [[Jade Goody]] (2009).<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/celebritynews/jade-goody/5033144/Jade-Goody-dies-after-cancer-battle-bringing-media-circus-to-end.html | work=The Daily Telegraph | location=London | title=Jade Goody dies after cancer battle bringing media circus to end | first=Sarah | last=Knapton | date=March 22, 2009 | accessdate=May 12, 2010}}</ref> *The [[News International phone hacking scandal]] (2011). Often overshadowed stories on the [[Libyan Civil War (2011)|Libyan]]/[[Syrian Civil War]]s, [[2011 East Africa drought|East African famine]], and [[2008–2012 global recession|economic crisis]].<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.periscopepost.com/2011/07/no-one-outside-of-the-media-political-circus-cares-about-the-phone-hacking-scandal/ | title=No one outside of the media-political circus cares about the phone hacking scandal | first=Linda | last=Rodriguez | date=July 22, 2011 | accessdate=August 17, 2011}}</ref> *The disappearance of [[Madeleine McCann]] (2008).<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/1902515/Master-of-media-circus-for-Madeleine-McCann.html |title=Master of media circus for Madeleine McCann |date=24 April 2008 |work=The Telegraph |accessdate=25 April 2014 }}</ref> *The [[McLibel case]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.brightknowledge.org/law/famous-cases-mclibel|title=Brightside Mentoring|website=www.brightknowledge.org}}</ref>
===United States=== [[File:Dominique Strauss-Kahn media circus.jpg|thumb|Cameras and reporters in front of the [[Dominique Strauss-Kahn|Strauss-Kahn]] apartment on May 26, 2011]] * [[Christine Jorgensen]] caused a media sensation when she returned from Denmark to the U.S. in 1952 after undergoing the "world's first sex change" operation. "Ex-GI Becomes Blonde Bombshell" was the headline in the ''[[Daily News (New York)|New York Daily News]]'' on December 1, 1952. *Coverage of the investigation and trial of the [[Tate murders|1969 murders]] of [[Sharon Tate]] and four others by the [[Manson family]].<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://www.amazon.com/Media-Circus-Private-Tragedy-Public/dp/1941631606|title=Media Circus: A Look at Private Tragedy in the Public Eye|last=Goldman|first=Kim|last2=Robertson|first2=Tatsha|date=2015-09-22|publisher=BenBella Books|isbn=9781941631607|language=English}}</ref> *David Gelman, Peter Greenberg, et al. in ''[[Newsweek]]'' on January 31, 1977: "Brooklyn born photographer and film producer Lawrence Schiller managed to make himself the sole journalist to witness the execution of [[Gary Gilmore]] in Utah....In the Gilmore affair, he was like a ringmaster in what became a media circus, with sophisticated newsmen scrambling for what he had to offer."<ref>Gelman, David, Greenberg, Peter S. et al., "Ringmaster at the circus," ''Newsweek''. New York: Jan. 31, 1977. Vol.89, Iss. 5; pg. 77. {{ISSN|0028-9604}}. http://search.proquest.com/docview/214345558/</ref> *The rescue of baby [[Jessica McClure]] (1987)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thenational.scot/news/15596299.How_the_rescue_of_Baby_Jessica_ushered_in_the_era_of_rolling_news/|title=How the rescue of Baby Jessica ushered in the era of rolling news|website=The National}}</ref> *The [[Central Park jogger case]] of 1989.<ref>{{citation|title=Encyclopedia of Juvenile Violence|page=30|author=Laura L. Finley|publisher=[[Greenwood Publishing Group]]|year=2007|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=PdOlie8UbVMC&pg=PA30}}</ref> *The [[O. J. Simpson murder case]] of 1994-1995.<ref name=pistorius-Mar2014/><ref name=pistorius-Apr2014/> *[[North American blizzard of 1996|The Blizzard of '96]] (1996). "...this storm ...so hyped by the media in the same way that the [[O. J. Simpson murder case]] became hyped as the "[[Trial of the century]]".<ref>(Elizabeth Davis, [[The Daily Beacon]], January 12, 1996).[https://web.archive.org/web/20021106090843/http://dailybeacon.utk.edu/issues/v71/n3/blizzard.3v.html]</ref> *The [[Elián González affair|Elián González custody conflict]] (2000).<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2000/apr/26/usa.cuba1 |title=Elian moves home to avoid media circus |date=25 April 2000 |accessdate=17 April 2014 |work=[[The Guardian]] }}</ref> *The trial of [[Martha Stewart]] (2004). "The stone-faced Stewart never broke stride as she cut a path through the media circus."<ref>''[[Newsweek]],'' "Martha's Fall," March 15, 2005 {{cite web|url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/4468819/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2006-01-01 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20051222214401/http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/4468819/ |archivedate=2005-12-22 |df= }}</ref> *The 2005 [[trial of Michael Jackson]] on child molestation charges and his [[Death of Michael Jackson|2009 death]]. *The disappearance of [[Drew Peterson|Stacy Peterson]] (2007).<ref>{{cite news| url=http://articles.chicagotribune.com/2012-01-16/entertainment/chi-drew-peterson-untouchable-movie-review-20120116_1_stacy-peterson-tragic-wives-joseph-hosey | work=Chicago Tribune | title=Lifetime's 'Untouchable' throws the book at Drew Peterson | date=January 16, 2012}}</ref> *[[Death of Caylee Anthony|The Casey Anthony murder trial]] (2011). "Once again, it was relentless media coverage that in large part fed the fascination with the case", Ford observed.<ref>https://news.yahoo.com/casey-anthony-trial-turned-media-frenzy-031041514.html</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digtriad.com/news/article/182093/57/Elon-Professor-Explains-Media-Frenzy-Around-Anthony-Case- |title=Casey Anthony Trial Media Frenzy Explained |work=digtriad.com |accessdate=10 December 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131019133839/http://www.digtriad.com/news/article/182093/57/Elon-Professor-Explains-Media-Frenzy-Around-Anthony-Case- |archivedate=19 October 2013 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2011/07/06/us-casey-idUSTRE7650HY20110706 | work=Reuters | title=Casey Anthony trial turned into media frenzy | date=July 6, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2011/07/06/earlyshow/main20077125.shtml | work=CBS News | title=Casey Anthony trial: Media frenzy at new heights}}</ref> * The [[shooting of Trayvon Martin]] (2012). "Here is where the media circus takes a decidedly ugly turn", Eric Deggans wrote.<ref>"[https://news.yahoo.com/blogs/cutline/trayvon-martin-shooting-debate-over-photos-escalates-155103512.html Trayvon Martin shooting: Debate over photos escalates]". Yahoo! News.</ref> <!--NOTE: UN-SOURCED? WILL BE DELETED.--> * The [[murder of Travis Alexander]] (2013), where Jodi Arias was found guilty of first-degree murder.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/05/23/jodi-arias-trial-media-coverage_n_3324549.html | work=Huffington Post | title=Jodi Arias Trial: An Over-The-Top Media-Spectacle | date=May 22, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-504083_162-57582996-504083/jodi-arias-trial-jurors-weigh-murder-charge-amid-real-life-soap-opera-spectacle | work=CBS News | title=Jodi Arias Trial: Jurors weigh murder charge amid "real-life soap opera" spectacle | date=May 6, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.myfoxphoenix.com/story/20973003/2013/02/05/jodi-arias-trial-media-circus |work=FOX News |title=Jodi Arias trial attracts watchers from across the nation |date=February 5, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130430074316/http://www.myfoxphoenix.com/story/20973003/2013/02/05/jodi-arias-trial-media-circus |archivedate=April 30, 2013 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=https://news.yahoo.com/arias-trial-tv-cameras-never-far-behind-215031135.html | work=Yahoo! News | title=In Arias trial, TV cameras never far behind | date=May 22, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.insideedition.com/headlines/6155-is-the-jodi-arias-trial-the-craziest-in-america | work=Inside Edition | title=Is the Jodi Arias Trial the Craziest in America? | date=April 11, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/05/12/amid-many-trials-frenzy-over-arias/2152919 | work=USA Today | title=Amid many trials, a frenzy over Jodi Arias | date=May 12, 2013 | first=Richard | last=Ruelas}}</ref> * Dismissal of and racial remarks by former owner of [[Los Angeles Clippers]] basketball team, [[Donald Sterling]] (2014).<ref>{{cite news |title=NBA ban of Donald Sterling sends the right message |url=http://www.jsonline.com/news/opinion/nba-ban-of-donald-sterling-sends-the-right-message-b99257746z1-257215761.html |work=Journal Sentinel |date=April 29, 2014 |first=James E |last=Causey |accessdate=May 7, 2014 }}</ref> *[[2015 San Bernardino attack]].
==See also== * [[24-hour news cycle]] * [[Cause célèbre]] * [[CNN effect]] * [[Deviancy amplification spiral]] * [[Dirty Laundry (Don Henley song)|"Dirty Laundry" (Don Henley song)]] * [[Feiler faster thesis]] * ''[[It's Not News, It's FARK]]'' * [[Richard Jewell]] * [[Media scrum]] * [[Missing white woman syndrome]] * [[Paparazzi]] * [[Perp walk]] * [[Sensationalism]] * [[Trial by media]] * [[Yellow journalism]]
==References== {{Reflist|2}}
{{Media culture}} {{Media manipulation}}

{{Infobox broadcasting network | name = Mega TV
(CableView Services Sdn Bhd) | type = [[Cable television|Cable]] | established = 18 October 1994 | airdate = 1 November 1995 | country = [[Malaysia]] | available = | slogan = '''The Multi-channel Experience!'''
(1994-1999)
'''Pilihan Sehati'''
(2000-2001) | motto = | licence_area = | headquarters = [[Petaling Jaya]], [[Selangor]] | broadcast_area = Nationwide | area = | owner = [[Media Prima|Sistem Televisyen Malaysia Berhad]] | launch_date = 1 November 1995 | dissolved = 2001 | groups = [[Pay television|Pay]] | former_affiliations = }} '''Mega TV''' was Malaysia's first ever [[subscription television|subscription]]-based [[pay television]] service. It was incorporated on 18 October 1994 and began transmissions on 1 November 1995 and was operated by [[Media Prima|TV3]]. It was particularly noted for its failure to break into the pay television market. Mega TV was transmitted from its headquarters in [[Bandar Utama]], in the northern fringes of [[Petaling Jaya]], [[Selangor]]. == History == Cableview Services Sdn Bhd or Mega TV was incorporated on 18 October 1994 by a consortium which consisted of [[TV3 (Malaysia)|Sistem Televisyen Malaysia Berhad]]. Cable-based transmissions was officially inaugurated by the 4th [[Prime Minister of Malaysia]], [[Mahathir bin Mohamad|Tun Doctor Mahathir Bin Mohamad]] and broadcasts from [[Petaling Jaya]] on 1 November 1995 through a microwave-based broadcast system Faced with stiff competition from the [[Astro (Malaysian satellite television)|Astro]] satellite television network which was launched seven months later, combined with the failures to expand its content, Mega TV ceased transmission in 2001 as a result, leaving Astro as the one and only pay-TV service provider in Malaysia. == Channel Listing == This is correct as of 2001 just before Mega TV's closure: {|class="wikitable" ! Name ! Language ! Owner ! Group ! Type |- | [[TV1 (Malaysia)|TV1]] | rowspan=3| [[Malay language|Malay]] | rowspan=2| [[Radio Televisyen Malaysia|RTM]] | rowspan=3| Free-to-air | rowspan=3| Terrestrial |- | [[TV2 (Malaysia)|TV2]] |- | [[TV3 (Malaysia)|TV3]] | [[Sistem Televisyen Malaysia Berhad|STMB]] |- | [[CNN International Asia Pacific|CNN International News]] | [[English language|English]] | [[CNN]] | News | rowspan=6| Subscription |- | [[Discovery Channel (South East Asian TV channel)|Discovery Channel]] | English (Malay subtitle) | [[Discovery Communications]] | Education |- | [[ESPN Asia|ESPN International Sports]] | English | [[ESPN]] | Sports |- | [[Vijay TV|Thangathirai]] | Tamil | [[Star Vijay]] | Tamil GEC |- | [[HBO Asia|HBO International Movies]] | English (Malay subtitle) | [[HBO]] | Movies |- | [[Cartoon Network (Southeast Asia)|Cartoon Network]] & [[Turner Classic Movies (Asia)|Turner Classic Movies]] | English (Malay subtitle) | [[Cartoon Network]] | Cartoons and classic movies |} == References == {{Empty section|date=July 2010}} == External links == * [https://web.archive.org/web/20001205135700/http://www.megatv.com.my/index.html Official site of Mega TV ] {{reflist}} {{Malaysia TV}} {{CATV Africa, Asia, and Oceania}} {{tv-station-stub}} [[Category:Television in Malaysia]] [[Category:1995 establishments in Malaysia]] [[Category:2001 disestablishments in Malaysia]] [[Category:Defunct television networks]] [[Category:Television channels and stations disestablished in 2001]] [[Category:Television channels and stations established in 1995]] [[Category:Media in Petaling Jaya]]

revision.text:
{{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} '''Military Miniaturism''' describes a hobby (some people would say it is an art) that covers military themed [[scale model|miniaturism]] of many types including, * [[model aircraft|aircraft]] * [[model figure|figures]], [[tin soldier]]s * [[ship model|ships]] * [[model military vehicle|vehicles]] * [[weapon]]s, [[Fortification|emplacements]] or [[Military equipment|equipment]]
Emphasis on realism, historical accuracy and scale congruity of the miniatures and their painting/finishing are important aspects of this hobby. Knowledge of history, events and geography also play a role in the development of subjects and themes. Complexity ranges from the simple assembly and painting of a model kit out of the box to the complete [[scratch building]] of a vehicle, aircraft or ship from materials such wood, plastic, metal or resin. Miniaturists compete for prizes and recognition among their peers in contests in most countries at various times of the year. The cost and skills involves mean that this has increasingly become a hobby for grown-ups rather than children, though there are still many kits suitable for completion by youngsters.
Often the military miniaturist will combine different kinds of miniatures in the same [[diorama]]; for example: vehicles and figures; aircraft and vehicles.
==See also==

{{italic title}} {{for|a sanctioned period of silent contemplation|Moment of silence}}
'''''Minute of Silence''''' ({{lang-ru|'''Минута молчания'''}}) was a joint radio and TV program in the [[Soviet Union]] broadcast on at 6:00 pm on May 9, [[Victory Day (Eastern Europe)|the day of the victory]] of the Soviet Union in the [[Great Patriotic war]]. It was first broadcast on [[Soviet Central Television]] in 1965, 20 years after the Allied victory over Nazi Germany. Aside from the minute of silence itself the main part of the program was a solemn address, commonly known as ''The Minute of Silence'', dedicated to all those who fell fighting the [[Nazi]] invasion of the Soviet Union.
The idea of the program was suggested by [[Irana Kazakova]]. Other people of the team who produced the first version were [[Ekaterina Tarkhanova]], [[Svetlana Volodina]], [[Arkadi Revenko]], Mesyatsev, Khazanov, Levitskaya, and other people assistants, artists, musical editors, etc.<ref name=irana>{{cite journal |url=http://www.journalist-virt.ru/mag.php?s=200505591&prn=1 |title=An interview with Irana Kazakova |publisher=[[Journalist (Russian magazine)|Journalist]] |date= 2005|issue= 5|page=59 |language=Russian |accessdate= }}</ref>
The program was started with the announcement "Attention, Attention! Moscow is speaking and broadcasting!"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.09may.ru/minuta_molchanija_text.htm|title=Minute of Silence|accessdate=January 11, 2018}}</ref> by the Soviet radio voice [[Yuri Levitan]], famous for his announcements during World War II. The very "minute of silence" was sounded with the toll of the [[Moscow Kremlin]] bells and the clock at the [[Spasskaya Tower]] striking seven in the evening. The address was initially narrated by well-known Soviet radio commenter and actress [[Vera Enyutina]]. The TV version was showing the flame on the background of a wall with the text "To the Memory of the Fallen." Due to its solemnity the address was informally known as "the prayer".<ref name=irana/>
After Enyutina emigrated to the [[United States]] the address was narrated by Levitan, and later by [[Igor Kirillov]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.kino-teatr.ru/kino/acter/sov/9423/bio/ |title=Vera Enyutina biography |publisher=kino-teatr.ru |language=Russian |accessdate= }}</ref> The text of the address was modified during the [[Brezhnev stagnation]] by [[Galina Shergova]] and [[Yevgeny Sinitsyn]], under the orders of the management. In particular, a piece about ''[[Malaya Zemlya]]'' was inserted (removed after [[Leonid Brezhnev]]'s death in the May 9, 1983 broadcast).<ref name=irana/>The text was replaced with a new one in 2015, with inserted footage from the first ever minute of silence from that year's Victory Day Parade, plus pictures of some of the many fatalities of the conflict.
Russia's [[Channel One (Russia)|Channel One]] and other networks (like [[Russia 1]]) still broadcast this special program today while [[RT (TV network)|RT]] broadcasts it in English, Spanish and Arabic for the benefit of its international viewers. Since 2002, it is broadcast at 6:55 pm, before that it started at around 6:45 in the evening. (Since 2014, RT only shows the minute itself.)
==References== {{reflist}}
== External links == * [http://www.09may.ru/minuta_molchanija_text.htm Minute of Silence text (Russian)] * [http://www.sovmusic.ru/m32/minutamo.mp3 First Minute of Silence (1965) audio], narrated by Vera Enyutina and Yuri Levitan * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ytVOBwozGLM Minute of Silence (2012) video], narrated by [[Igor Kirillov]]
[[Category:Television in the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Radio in the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Aftermath of World War II in the Soviet Union and Russia]] [[Category:1945 in the Soviet Union]] [[Category:1960s Soviet television series]]

{{Infobox television | show_name = My Story for You | image = My Story for You Official Poster.jpg | caption = Drama poster | show_name_2 = | genre = [[romance novel|Romance]]
[[Drama film|Drama]] | based_on = ''Love the Whole World'' by Tangjia Sanshao | writer = Mobao Feibao | director = {{ubl|Yu Cuihua|Guo Hu{{cite web|url=http://ent.huanqiu.com/yuleyaowen/2017-06/10885161.html|title=《为了你我愿意热爱整个世界》导演余翠华 郭虎亮相揭幕仪式|date=June 22, 2017|website=Huanqiu|language=zh}}}} | starring = {{ubl|[[Luo Jin]]|[[Zheng Shuang (actress, born 1991)|Zheng Shuang]]}} | voices = | opentheme = | endtheme = | composer = | country = China | language = Mandarin | num_seasons = 1 | num_episodes = 48 | producer = Xiong Xiaoling | executive_producer = Teng Huatao | editor = | location = [[Shanghai]], [[Beijing]], [[New York City|New York]] | runtime = 45 mins | cinematography = | company = Croton Media (New Horizons) | channel = [[iQiyi]] | picture_format = | audio_format = | first_run = China | first_aired = {{Start date|2018|6|18}} | last_aired = | preceded_by = | followed_by = | related = | website = | website_title = | production_website = | production_website_title = }} '''''My Story for You''''' ([[Chinese language|Chinese]]: 为了你我愿意热爱整个世界) is a 2018 Chinese television series based on Tangjia Sanshao (唐家三少)'s novel of the same name; starring [[Luo Jin]] and [[Zheng Shuang (actress, born 1991)|Zheng Shuang]]. The story is based on the author's real-life story on his struggles and hardships before he became a famous novel writer, as well as his romance with his wife.{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2017-05-04/doc-ifyeycfp9226198.shtml|title=《为了你》曝海报 罗晋郑爽跨越20年时空对话|date=May 4, 2017|work=Sina|language=zh}} The series premiered on June 18, 2018 via [[iQiyi]].{{cite web|url=http://ent.ifeng.com/a/20180612/43056577_0.shtml?_zbs_baidu_bk|title=《为了你》定档6月18日 罗晋郑爽逐梦青春|date=June 12, 2018|website=ifeng|language=zh}} The series received positive reviews for its heart-warming and relatable story.{{cite web|url=http://ent.ifeng.com/a/20180619/43059034_0.shtml|title= 《为了你》首播好评如潮 罗晋郑爽互怼网恋|date=June 19, 2018|website=ifeng|language=zh}} ==Synopsis== In 1998, Zhang Changgong gets his first taste of success as a developer in an IT company. At the same time, he meets and falls in love with Li Muzi, a kind and intelligent university student. Unfortunately the IT industry soon faces an economic crisis, and Zhang Changgong is left unemployed. With the help of his friends and family, Changgong faces the challenges head on, and eventually becomes a top-selling author. To court her, he wrote 137 love letters in a year, exceeding 1 million Chinese characters. To guard her, he created 16 novels with more than 40 million words, working a wonder of internet literature. This is the love story that unfolded for 16 years already between Tang Jian Shao and his wife. ~ Novel Summary ==Cast== ===Main=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! style="width:13%"|Actor !! style="width:17%"|Character !! Introduction |- | [[Luo Jin]] ||Zhang Changgong || A man with a never-say-die spirit. |- | [[Zheng Shuang (actress, born 1991)|Zheng Shuang]] || Li Muzi || Only daughter of a wealthy military family. Kind and pure, she stays by Zhang Changgong's side and weather all sorts of storms with him. |- |} ===Supporting=== ====People around Zhang Changgong==== {| class="wikitable" |- ! style="width:13%"|Actor !! style="width:17%"|Character !! Introduction |- | Pang Hanchen{{cite web|url=http://ent.ifeng.com/a/20180619/43058973_0.shtml|title=《为了你》上线 庞瀚辰演绎轻苏男感情归属成谜|date=June 18, 2018|website=ifeng|language=zh}} || Han Dong || A rebellious youth who later becomes an intelligent and capable business executive. Zhang Changgong's good friend, who also likes Zhang Yaoyao. |- | Zhang Yishang{{cite web|url=http://ent.163.com/17/0720/10/CPPIENJP00038793.html|title=《为了你》杀青 张艺上成郑爽小姑子|date=July 20, 2017|website=Netease|language=zh}} || Zhang Yaoyao ||Zhang Changgong's sister. A passionate and unrestrained lady who is unyielding in love. |- | [[Wong Gongliang]] || Li Ningfeng || A kind, strict but obtuse policeman, Zhang Yaoyao's husband. |- | Yang Jincheng{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2017-05-08/doc-ifyeychk7132277.shtml?_t_t_t=0.8203896428458393|title=杨金承《为了你》搭档罗晋郑爽 演绎20年暖心不变|date=May 8, 2017|website=Sina|language=zh}} ||Wei Xiaoshan || Zhang Changgong's good friend. A gentle, loyal and caring man. |- | Li Yiyi{{cite web|url=http://ent.163.com/17/0505/16/CJMEO29M00038793.html|title=李依伊《为了你我愿意热爱整个世界》还原甜美少女|date=May 5, 2017|website=Netease|language=zh}} || Xiao Ai || Zhang Changgong's high school classmate and first love. |- | Qin Yiming{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2017-12-06/doc-ifypikwu2966624.shtml|title=《为了你我愿意热爱整个世界》秦亦铭抗命运浪潮|date=December 6, 2017|website=Sina|language=zh}} || Liu Mingtao || Zhang Changgong's good friend. He is ambitious and eager for success, thus causing him to walk on the wrong path. |- | Jin Hao{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2017-05-05/doc-ifyeycfp9268135.shtml|title=《为了你我愿意热爱整个世界》金浩饰罗晋挚友|date=May 5, 2018|website=Sina|language=zh}} || Li Song || Zhang Changgong's good friend and colleague, whom met him through an online platform. |- | [[Kong Lin]] || Du Juan || Zhang Changgong's mother. An overbearing and imposing woman. |- | Luo Gang || Li Chun || Zhang Changgong's father. An honest and dependable man. |- | Mu Fengbin || CEO Lin || Zhang Changgong's superior. |} ====People around Li Muzi==== {| class="wikitable" |- ! style="width:13%"|Actor !! style="width:17%"|Character !! Introduction |- | Ren Shen{{cite web|url=http://ent.qq.com/a/20170626/039589.htm|title=《为了你我愿意热爱整个世界》任坤饰演小秋|date=June 26, 2017|website=Tencent|language=zh}} || Xiao Qiu || Li Muzi's roommate and close friend. |- | [[Du Zhiguo]] || || Li Muzi's grandfather. |- | Cai Gang || || Li Muzi's father. |- | Juan Zi || || Li Muzi's mother. |- | Gao Shuguang || || Li Muzi's uncle. |- |} ====Others==== {| class="wikitable" |- ! style="width:13%"|Actor !! style="width:17%"|Character !! Introduction |- | Sun Jialing{{cite web|url=http://ent.qq.com/a/20170821/035755.htm#p=1|title=孙嘉灵新戏纽约杀青 期待用心饰演的"梅欣"|date=August 21, 2017|website=Tencent|language=zh}} || Mei Xin || |- | Song Nanxi || Lin Mian || |- | Chen Shuai || Xiao Gong || |- | Xie Ningmeng || Chong Jiayou || |- | Zhang Wei || || Han Dong's close friend. |- | Huang Yuecheng{{cite web|url=http://ent.163.com/17/0815/11/CRSJCLJP00038793.html|title=黄玥程参演《为了你，我愿意热爱整个世界》杀青|date=August 15, 2017|website=Netease|language=zh}} || Wei Ming|| |- | [[Huang Jingyu]] || Changgong Wei || Special appearance. |} ==Soundtrack== {{Tracklist |collapsed = |total_length = |all_writing = |all_lyrics = |all_music = |arranger_credits = |extra_column = Singers |title1 = My Dream (我的梦) |note1 = Opening theme song |lyrics1 = Wang Haitao
[[Jane Zhang]] |music1 = Andy Love |arranger1 = |extra1 = [[Jane Zhang]] | title2 = Beautiful Mood (美丽心情) | note2 = | lyrics2 = Yiu Him | music2 = [[Miyuki Nakajima]] | arranger2 = Jeffrey Yip | extra2 = [[Liu Xijun]] | title3 = Superstar of the Chaotic Era (乱世巨星) | note3 = | lyrics3 = Wasabi | music3 = Ronald Ng | arranger3 = Jeffrey Yip | extra3 = Zhang Hexuan | title4 = Intuition (直觉) | note4 = | lyrics4 = Yiu Him | music4 = Eric Chen | arranger4 = Jeffrey Yip | extra4 = [[Hu Xia]] | title5 = Thank You For Your Love 1999 (谢谢你的爱1999) | note5 = | lyrics5 = Lin Linan | music5 = Chen Junting | arranger5 = Jeffrey Yip | extra5 = Li Hao | title6 = Love the Whole World (热爱整个世界) | note6 = | lyrics6 = Huang Yuli | music6 = Huang Yuli | arranger6 = Yu Hao | extra6 = Reno Wang |title7 = Love a Girl Nicely (好好爱个女孩) |note7 = Ending theme song |lyrics7 = Xiao Ke |music7 = Xiao Ke |arranger7 = Wang Siyu |extra7 = [[Jeff Chang (singer)|Jeff Chang]] }} ==Production== The series is directed by Yu Cuihua (''[[Love O2O (TV series)|Love O2O]]'', ''[[Eternal Love (TV series)|Eternal Love]]''), written by Mobao Feibao (''[[Scarlet Heart]]'', ''[[My Sunshine]]'') and produced by Xiong Xiaoling (''Love O2O'', ''My Sunshine''). Other notable cast members include Teng Huatao (''[[Dwelling Narrowness]]'', ''Fu Chen'') as its executive producer and Di Kun (''[[To Be a Better Man]]'') as its artistic director.{{cite web|url=http://ent.ifeng.com/a/20170320/42863692_0.shtml|title=《为了你》首曝成长版视频 罗晋郑爽全明星阵容揭晓|date=March 20, 2017|work=Phoenix Television|language=zh}} Tangjia Sanshao, the original author of the novel, acts as the promotional ambassador of the series. This is the first cross-over collaboration between entertainment media (television) and literary work.{{cite web|url=http://ent.163.com/16/0811/17/BU73BFEC000333J5.html|title=唐家三少最新同名小说《为了你》电视剧版开拍|work=NetEase|date=August 11, 2017|language=zh}} The series was filmed in Shanghai, Beijing and New York from April to August 2017.{{cite web|url=http://ent.163.com/17/0609/08/CMFNVASO000380EN.html|title=《为了你》探班 罗晋郑爽话家常送绿豆汤|date=June 9, 2017|website=Netease|language=zh}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[https://baike.baidu.com/item/%E4%B8%BA%E4%BA%86%E4%BD%A0%E6%88%91%E6%84%BF%E6%84%8F%E7%83%AD%E7%88%B1%E6%95%B4%E4%B8%AA%E4%B8%96%E7%95%8C/19519341 ''My Story for You''] on [[Baidu]] [[Category:Chinese romance television series]] [[Category:Television programs based on Chinese novels]] [[Category:2018 Chinese television series debuts]] [[Category:Television series by Croton Media]] [[Category:IQiyi original programming]] [[Category:Chinese web series]] [[Category:2018 Chinese television series endings]] [[Category:2018 web series debuts]]

{{Infobox website | name = NetEase, Inc. | logo = Netease logo 2.svg | logo_size = 150px | type = [[Public company|Public]] | traded_as = {{NASDAQ|NTES}}
[[NASDAQ-100|NASDAQ-100 Component]] | key_people = Qiu Shan Ge (CEO) | industry = Internet | products = [[Online services]] | revenue = {{gain}} [[Chinese yuan|CN¥]] 54.102 billion (2017){{cite web|url=http://ir.netease.com/phoenix.zhtml?c=122303&p=irol-fundIncomeA | title = NetEase - Fundamentals - Annual Income Statement}} | operating_income = {{decrease}} CN¥ 12.154 billion (2017) | net_income = {{decrease}} CN¥ 10.849 billion (2017) | assets = {{nowrap|{{gain}} CN¥ 71.031 billion (2017)}} | num_employees = 18,129 (December 2017){{cite web|url=http://ir.netease.com/phoenix.zhtml?c=122303&p=irol-faq|title=Investor FAQs|accessdate=August 3, 2018}} | homepage = {{URL|http://www.163.com/|163.com}} | foundation = {{Start date and age|1997|6}}
[[Guangzhou]], [[Guangdong]], China{{cite web|url=http://gb.corp.163.com/gb/about/overview.html |title=NetEase - Corporation Profile |publisher=NetEase.com, Inc.}} | founder = [[Ding Lei]] | location = [[Guangzhou, China]] | alexa = {{Increase}} 262 ({{as of|2018|8|3|alt=August 2018}}){{cite web|url= http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/163.com |title= 163.com Site Overview | publisher= [[Alexa Internet]] |accessdate= 2014-07-04 }} }} [[File:NetEaseHangzhouOffice.jpg|thumb|NetEase office in Hangzhou]] '''NetEase, Inc.''' ({{zh|s=网易|t=網易|p=WǎngYì}}) is a Chinese Internet technology company providing online services centered on content, community, communications and commerce. The company was founded in 1997 by Lebunto. NetEase develops and operates online PC and mobile games, advertising services, email services and e-commerce platforms in China. It is [[List of largest Internet companies|one of the largest Internet]] and video game companies in the world.{{cite news|title=Tencent leads the top 25 public game companies with $10.2 billion in revenues {{!}} GamesBeat|url=https://venturebeat.com/2017/03/23/tencent-leads-the-top-25-public-game-companies-with-10-2-billion-in-revenues/|work=venturebeat.com}} Some of NetEase's games include the ''Westward Journey'' series (''[[Fantasy Westward Journey]]'', ''[[Westward Journey Online II]]'', ''Fantasy Westward Journey II'', and ''New Westward Journey Online II''), as well as other games, such as ''Tianxia III'', ''Heroes of Tang Dynasty Zero'' and ''Ghost II''. NetEase also partners with [[Blizzard Entertainment]] to operate local versions of ''[[World of Warcraft]]'', ''[[Hearthstone (video game)|Hearthstone]]'', ''[[StarCraft II]]'', ''[[Diablo III: Reaper of Souls]]'' and ''[[Overwatch (video game)|Overwatch]]'' in China. They are also developing their very first self-developed VR multiplayer online game with an open world setting, which is called Nostos.https://steamcommunity.com/gid/103582791463197607/announcements/detail/3398424857423849659 ==History== The company was founded in June 1997 by Chinese entrepreneur [[Ding Lei]], and grew rapidly due in part to its investment in [[search engine technology]]{{cite web|url=http://www.httpuseragent.org/list/YoudaoBot+1.0-n742.htm |title=Netease Search Engine - Youdao/yodao spider |publisher=Httpuseragent.org |date=2008-12-31 |accessdate=2012-08-17}} and massively multiplayer online role-playing gaming. Its first MMORPG developed internally was ''[[Fantasy Westward Journey]]''. The ''Westward Journey'' series began in 2001, and includes ''[[Westward Journey Online II]]''. *2004: NetEase's founder and chief architect William Ding ([[Ding Lei]]) won the Wharton Infosys Business Transformation Award for his innovative use of information technology. Ding became one of the wealthiest individuals in China after founding NetEase. * * 2008: The 163.com domain attracted at least 1.8 million visitors annually by 2008 according to a [[Compete.com]] survey.{{cite web|author=us Data Only |url=http://siteanalytics.compete.com/163.com?metric=uv |title=Siteanalytics.compete.com |publisher=Siteanalytics.compete.com |date=2011-10-26 |accessdate=2012-08-17}} * 2010: The site was the 28th most visited site in the world according to [[Alexa Internet|Alexa's internet rankings]]{{cite web| url=http://www.alexa.com/topsites/global;1| title=Alexa Top 500 Global Sites| accessdate=2010-04-15}} and in August 2010, the site was the 27th most visited site drawing more traffic than the websites of [[AOL]], [[BBC]], [[Flickr]], [[Craigslist]], [[Apple Inc.|Apple]], [[CNN]], [[LinkedIn]], [[Adobe Systems|Adobe]], [[CNet]], [[ESPN]]. * 2012: The company's official English name was changed from NetEase.com, Inc to NetEase, Inc.{{cite web|url=http://tech.sina.com.cn/i/2012-03-29/19036890626.shtml|title=NetEase English Name Changes|publisher=[[Sina.com]]|date=March 29, 2012|accessdate=March 29, 2012|language=Chinese}} In April 2012, NetEase began testing a restaurant recommendation mobile app called "Fan Fan".{{cite web |url=http://www.brightwire.com/company/9348-netease-com-inc |title=Follow news on Netease.com, Inc. |publisher=BrightWire |date= |accessdate=2012-08-17 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130119012035/http://www.brightwire.com/company/9348-netease-com-inc |archivedate=2013-01-19 |df= }}{{cite web|title=Netease Begins Testing for Mobile App "Fan Fan" on Thursday.|url=http://www.brightwire.com/news/199632-netease-begins-testing-for-mobile-app-fan-fan-on-thursday|publisher=BrightWire|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120727015120/http://www.brightwire.com/news/199632-netease-begins-testing-for-mobile-app-fan-fan-on-thursday|archivedate=2012-07-27|df=}} The company collaborated with coursera.org to provide [[Massive Open Online Course]] (MOOC) in China.{{cite web|title=Coursera partners with NetEase to deliver free online learning in China.|url=http://asiancorrespondent.com/114752/coursera-partners-with-netease-to-deliver-free-online-learning-in-china/}} *2017: NetEase makes an agreement with the [[United States|American]] company [[Marvel Comics]] to develop a comic based on a Chinese superhero, in addition 12 comic copies by Marvel will be released online such as ''[[The Amazing Spider-Man (comic)|The Amazing Spider-Man]]'', ''[[Captain America]]'', and ''[[Guardians of the Galaxy]]''. == Businesses == * PC-client & Mobile Games: provider of self-developed online client games to Internet users in China; licensee of games by [[Blizzard Entertainment]]; developer & publisher of mobile games. ** Esports: Running an esports team called the [[Shanghai Dragons]], which takes part in the [[Overwatch League]]. * Internet Media: Operating a network of mobile applications, services and social communication platforms, as well as Internet portals with enriched content. * E-mail Services: Largest provider of free e-mail services in China with more than 940 million users as of 2017, in addition to 163.com, the company also runs 188.com, 126.com and more.[https://wccftech.com/netease-q2-results-revenue-grows-to-2-billion-games-generate-1-4bn/ NetEase Q2 2017: Revenue Grows to $2 Billion, Games Generate $1.4bn], Chris Wray, WCCFTECH, Aug 10, 2017 * Youdao Products: Specialized online tools including Youdao Dictionary, Youdao Cloudnote and Huihui.cn. * E-commerce: services available to Chinese consumers on both desktop and mobile including Kaola.com, NetEase's self operated cross-border e-commerce platform, online video broadcasting services and insurance products.{{Cite web|title = NetEase - Presentation|url = http://ir.netease.com/phoenix.zhtml?c=122303&p=irol-sharepresentations|website = ir.netease.com|accessdate = 2015-10-16}} == Games == [[File:PAX SPEEDY NINJA.png|thumb|264x264px|Gamers trying the new release of Speedy Ninja at PAX 2015]] PC Games: ''[[Fantasy Westward Journey|Fantasy Westward Journey II]], [[Westward Journey Online II]], New Ghost, Tianxia III, Revelation, Demon Seals, Hegemon-‐King of Western Chu{{Cite web|title = NetEase - Fact Sheet|url = http://ir.netease.com/phoenix.zhtml?c=122303&p=irol-factsheet|website = ir.netease.com|accessdate = 2015-10-16}} Mobile Games: ''[[Fantasy Westward Journey]]'' mobile, ''[[Westward Journey Online II|Westward Journey Online]]'' mobile, ''Invincible'', ''Kung Fu Panda 3'' mobile game, ''The X-‐World, [[Kai-Ri-Sei Million Arthur]], Chrono Blade'' and ''Hearthstone, Survival Royale, [[Rules of Survival]], Knives Out, Fortcraft, Onmyoji'' series and Identity V. New games planned for launch: ''Fantasy Westward Journey: Warriors, New Ghost Mobile'', a series of new titles based on novels by Gu Long, and a version of ''Minecraft'' and ''Minecraft: Pocket Edition'' for China. === Licensed online games === * Commercially re-launched World of Warcraft in September 2009, which used to be operated by another company, The9 Limited * StarCraft II: Heart of the Swarm launched in PRC in July 2013 * Launched free-to-play digital strategy card game Hearthstone in PRC in Jan 2014; mobile version launched in April 2015 * Open beta testing of Heroes of the Storm started in China in May 2015 * Initiated open beta testing in PRC of Diablo III: Reaper of Souls in April 2015 * Three-‐year agreement to license Blizzard's upcoming title Overwatch in PRC * Operates [[Overwatch (video game)|Overwatch]] in China * Agreement to license [[Mojang]]s [[Minecraft]] and Minecraft: Pocket Edition in China{{cite web|url=http://mojang.com/2016/05/minecraft-is-coming-to-china/|title=Minecraft is coming to China|website=mojang.com}} ** Operates the third-party Minecraft-related Hypixel China Server{{cite web|url=https://hypixel.net/threads/hypixel-is-coming-to-china.1131484/|title=Hypixel is coming to China|publisher=}} * Will assume the publishing of [[Eve Online|EVE Online]] in the Chinese market starting in October 2018.{{Cite web|url=https://www.eveonline.com/article/pcrt4h/the-next-step-for-eve-china-and-serenity-announcing-partnership-with|title=The Next Step For EVE China & Serenity – Announcing Partnership With NetEase! {{!}} EVE Online|website=EVE Online|language=en|access-date=2018-08-01}} * Developed Diablo Immortal for iOS and Android. == Expansion == NetEase launched their first Western Headquarters in August 2014 bringing one of the largest tech companies in China to the US.{{Cite web|title = NetEase North America|url = http://www.netease-na.com/#!/about|website = www.netease-na.com|accessdate = 2015-10-16}} In 2015, NetEase North America, the San Francisco-based arm of the Chinese technology giant, announced a new funding initiative for independent developers. Known as the NetEase Success Fund, the scheme offers an alternative to traditional publishing by providing up to $500,000 for each accepted developer to fund marketing and advertising. Furthermore, developers awarded funding retain the rights, creative control, and full ownership of their products. In December 2015, NetEase Capital Venture arm has made a $2.5 million investment into Reforged Studios, a privately held game studio based in Helsinki. == Music streaming service == {{Main|NetEase Music}} NetEase has an on-demand music-streaming service; 网易云音乐 (roughly "NetEase cloud music").{{Cite web|url = http://music.163.com/|title = 网易云音乐 听见好时光 (NetEase cloud music to listen to the good times)|date = |accessdate = 2015-05-03|website = 网易云音乐 (NetEase cloud music)|publisher = |last = |first = }} == Significance of the number 163 == NetEase's official website address is 163.com. This was attributed to the past where Chinese internet users had to dial "163" to connect to the internet, before the availability of broadband internet.{{Cite web|url=https://newrepublic.com/article/117608/chinese-number-websites-secret-meaning-urls|title=The Secret Messages Inside Chinese URLs|date=May 1, 2014|accessdate = February 1, 2016|website = newrepublic.com|publisher = The New Republic|last=Beam|first = Christopher}} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== * {{official website}} {{Finance links | name = NetEase | symbol = NTES | sec_cik = NTES | yahoo = NTES | google = NTES }} {{NASDAQ-100}} {{Chinese Web portals}} {{Major Internet companies}} {{Major video game companies}} [[Category:NetEase| ]] [[Category:Chinese websites]] [[Category:Companies based in Guangzhou]] [[Category:Companies based in Beijing]] [[Category:Chinese companies established in 1997]] [[Category:Companies listed on NASDAQ]] [[Category:Internet companies of China]] [[Category:Online companies of China]] [[Category:Video game companies of China]] [[Category:Video game development companies]] [[Category:Video game publishers]] [[Category:Chinese brands]] [[Category:Chinese news websites]]

page.title: Prostitution in the Republic of Macedonia

revision.text:
'''Prostitution in the Republic of Macedonia''' is legal, though with various restrictions,<ref name="spl">{{cite web|title=Sex Work Law - Countries|url=http://spl.ids.ac.uk/sexworklaw/countries|website=Sexuality, Poverty and Law|accessdate=22 February 2018|language=en}}</ref> and common.<ref name="swannet">{{cite web|title=Macedonia|url=http://swannet.org/en/countries/macedonia|website=SWAN|accessdate=22 February 2018|language=en}}</ref> [[UNAIDS]] estimate there are 3588 [[prostitute]]s in the country.<ref>{{cite web |title=Sex workers: Population size estimate - Number, 2016 |url=http://www.aidsinfoonline.org/gam/stock/shared/dv/PivotData_2018_7_22_636678151733621264.htm |website=www.aidsinfoonline.org |publisher=UNAIDS |accessdate=21 July 2018}}</ref> The Macedonian government is trying to clamp down on [[prostitution]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.peacewomen.org/news/Macedonia/newsarchive03/sextrade.html|title=Sex Slave Racket Clampdown in Macedonia<!-- Bot generated title -->|author=|date=|website=peacewomen.org|accessdate=10 October 2017 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20040125004655/http://www.peacewomen.org/news/Macedonia/newsarchive03/sextrade.html |archive-date= 25 Jan 2004 }}</ref>
STAR-STAR (Association for support of marginalised workers) is a sex worker led support group. It's Executive Board is exclusively made up of sex workers. STAR-STAR was the first sex workers collective in the [[Balkans]].<ref name="swannet" />
The country is a major transit point for prostitution to the west.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.state.gov/g/drl/rls/hrrpt/2006/78826.htm|title=Country Report on Human Rights Practices in Macedonia|author=|date=6 March 2007|website=U.S. Department of State|accessdate=2 November 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Gall |first=Carlotta |url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9F01E5DF133DF93BA15754C0A9679C8B63 |title=Macedonia Village Is Center Of Europe Web in Sex Trade - NYTimes.com |publisher=New York Times |date=2001-07-28 |accessdate=2010-03-31}}</ref> The trafficking of women for sex is worth billions in Macedonia and is considered to be run primarily by [[Albania]]n gangsters.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/3071971|title=Sex, drugs and guns in the Balkans|author1=David Binder|author2=Preston Mendenhall|date=2013|publisher=NBC News|accessdate=2 November 2015}}</ref> The reputed '[[Boss (crime)|kimgpin]]' of [[sex trafficking]], Dilaver Bojku, was murdered by a close range gunshot to the head in August 2017.<ref>{{cite web|title=Macedonian prostitution kingpin shot dead by unknown gunman|url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2017/08/15/macedonian-prostitution-kingpin-shot-dead-by-unknown-gunman.html|website=Fox News|accessdate=22 February 2018|date=15 August 2017}}</ref>
==Legal situation== Activities related to prostitution are prohibited in the [[Republic of Macedonia]] by both the ''Law on Misdemeanours Against the Public Order and Peace'' and the ''Criminal Law 1996''.<ref name="spl" /><ref name="swannet" />
[[Soliciting]] in a public place is prohibited by article 19 of the Law on Misdemeanours. The article also prohibits providing space for an act of prostitution. As restaurants, bars and hotels are defined as public places, owners of such places can be fined if prostitution occurs on the premises. Sex in public is also prohibited.<ref name="spl" /><ref name="swannet" />
Article 191 of the Criminal Law prohibits third party involvement, such as [[Procuring (prostitution)|procuring]], [[pimping]] and profiting from the prostitution of others.<ref name="spl" /><ref name="swannet" />
Law enforcement is corrupt,<ref name="state17" /> and often violent towards sex workers. In a 2007 study reported 82.4% of sex workers had been assaulted by the police.<ref name="spl" />
==Sex trafficking== {{see also|Human trafficking in the Republic of Macedonia}} Macedonia is a source, transit, and destination country for women and children subjected to sex trafficking. Women and girls in Macedonia are subjected to sex trafficking within the country in restaurants, bars, and nightclubs. Foreign victims subjected to sex trafficking in Macedonia typically originate from [[Eastern Europe]], particularly Albania, [[Bosnia and Herzegovina]], [[Kosovo]], [[Romania]], [[Serbia]], and [[Ukraine]]. Citizens of Macedonia and foreign victims transiting Macedonia are subjected to sex trafficking in Southern, Central, and Western Europe. Migrants and refugees, particularly women and unaccompanied minors, travelling or being smuggled through Macedonia are vulnerable to trafficking. Students are vulnerable to false employment promises in other European countries. Traffickers frequently bribe police and labour inspectors. Police have been investigated and convicted for complicity in human trafficking.<ref name="state17">{{cite web|title=Macedonia 2017 Trafficking in Persons Report|url=https://www.state.gov/j/tip/rls/tiprpt/countries/2017/271232.htm|website=U.S. Department of State|accessdate=22 February 2018}}{{PD-notice}}</ref>
Articles 418(a) and (d) of the criminal code prohibit all forms of trafficking and prescribe a minimum penalty of four years imprisonment for trafficking adults and 12 years imprisonment for trafficking children. In December 2015, the government deleted article 191(a) on child prostitution, which had allowed the prosecution of child sex traffickers for a lesser offence, and amended article 418(d). The government investigated one sex trafficking case involving six suspects for sex and labour trafficking of children, compared to zero investigations in 2015.<ref name="state17" />
The [[United States Department of State]] [[Office to Monitor and Combat Trafficking in Persons]] ranks the Republic of Macedonia as a '[[Trafficking in Persons Report#Ranking System|Tier 2]]' country.<ref name="state17" />
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://starsexwork.org/ STAR-STAR] (Sex workers organisation)
{{Europe in topic|Prostitution in}}
